Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body: ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

> Can we use the new definitions to simplify `FixedPoints.subfield`? Do we already have the subring and subsemiring versions?

I don't think we have `FixedPoints.subring` nor `FixedPoints.subsemiring`. Currently `FixedPoints.subfield` seems to be defined using `Subfield.copy`, but I don't know if we need or want that for these.

I think the use of `copy` is because the author wanted to make the carrier defeq to [MulAction.fixedPoints](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Basic.html#MulAction.fixedPoints) (which is already the case for everything you add in this PR) but also want to easily show it's a subfield (so they made use of `iInf` in `Subfield`). Now if we refactor FixedPoints.subfield and build it step by step from submonoid, subgroup, subsemiring, subring, etc. then we just need to fill in one additional field `inv_mem'` rather than using `iInf` to get all fields at once, so `copy` would be unnecessary.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:

  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7740591314/job/21105851697)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7740591314/job/21105851358)
Can we use the new definitions to simplify `FixedPoints.subfield`? Do we already have the subring and subsemiring versions?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
maintainer merge
maintainer merge
Can we use the new definitions to simplify `FixedPoints.subfield`? Do we already have the subring and subsemiring versions?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Note that these names are at odds with [FixedPoints.subfield](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/Fixed.html#FixedPoints.subfield), [FixedPoints.intermediateField](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/Galois.html#FixedPoints.intermediateField), etc.

a common golf pattern (similarly below)
```suggestion
  mul_mem' ha hb _ := by rw [MulDistribMulAction.smul_mul, ha, hb]
```
Wow! I'm not aware of this...
`to_additive` doesn't work right? A bit annoying, but this problem has been known in the context of AddMonoidAlgebra ...
Yeah, it doesn't work.

I feel that `Submonoid.fixedPoints` would be a better name because Lean 4 allows dot notation for them, but we'd need to change the existing FixedPoints.subfield etc. And since you're using the notations `^*` `^+`, there's not much motivation to have good notation. Let me send this to a maintainer to decide whether we want to go that route.
I think we can punt on this for now.

I think the preferred name is
```suggestion
  mul_mem' ha hb _ := by rw [smul_mul', ha, hb]
```
(Untested)
Can you add a lemma about `toSubmonoid` and similarly for the additive case?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/GroupAction/Basic): define subgroups fixed by group actions

source.title: feat(GroupTheory/GroupAction/Basic): define homomorphisms of fixed subgroups induced by homomorphisms of groups

nodes.body: maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.
Can we use the new definitions to simplify `FixedPoints.subfield`? Do we already have the subring and subsemiring versions?

> Can we use the new definitions to simplify `FixedPoints.subfield`? Do we already have the subring and subsemiring versions?

I don't think we have `FixedPoints.subring` nor `FixedPoints.subsemiring`. Currently `FixedPoints.subfield` seems to be defined using `Subfield.copy`, but I don't know if we need or want that for these.

I think the use of `copy` is because the author wanted to make the carrier defeq to [MulAction.fixedPoints](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Basic.html#MulAction.fixedPoints) (which is already the case for everything you add in this PR) but also want to easily show it's a subfield (so they made use of `iInf` in `Subfield`). Now if we refactor FixedPoints.subfield and build it step by step from submonoid, subgroup, subsemiring, subring, etc. then we just need to fill in one additional field `inv_mem'` rather than using `iInf` to get all fields at once, so `copy` would be unnecessary.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
